scriptos.name: 1-Wire Devices Scan
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description: Initializes a 1-Wire bus on a single GPIO and finds all the family IDs and serial numbers of slave devices.

scriptos.name: ADC Reader
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description:
Simple level and voltage reader on a GPIO using an analog-to-digital converter (ADC).
                          You can specify the dB applied attenuation and the bits resolution.

scriptos.name: BLE Scan
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description: Initializes the Bluetooth Low Energy radio and scans BLE devices via advertising data.

scriptos.name: BLE iBeacon
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description:
Initializes the Bluetooth Low Energy radio and simulates an Apple iBeacon object. The advertising message broadcasts an UUID corresponding to "B.SCRIPTO_BEACON" in binary with the short name "ScriptOmator" while the iBeacon is the response to an active scanner.
The iBeacon (Apple beacon format) data are:
Major = 123  /  Minor = 456  /  TX at 1 meter = -55 dB

scriptos.name: CAN/TWAI Loopback Test
scriptos.author: JetPax
scriptos.description: Test the CAN/TWAI module with internal loopback mode. This test verifies that the CAN module is properly integrated and working. No external hardware is required - the test uses internal loopback mode within the ESP32's TWAI controller. Pin configuration is automatically detected from your board definition. For real CAN bus communication with OpenInverter, you'll need: A CAN transceiver (SN65HVD230 recommended for 3.3V), 120Ω termination resistors at both ends of the bus, and use mode=NORMAL instead of LOOPBACK.

scriptos.name: CAN Speed Test
scriptos.author: jetpax
scriptos.description:
Measures CAN bus throughput using loopback mode.
                         Tests transmission and reception speed with various frame sizes.
                         Useful for benchmarking CAN performance and validating hardware setup.

scriptos.name: CANopen Bus Scanner
scriptos.author: Scriptomatic Team
scriptos.description: Scan CANopen network for devices by sending SDO (Service Data Object) requests. This tool discovers CANopen nodes on the bus by attempting to read the device type (object 0x1000) from each possible node ID. Useful for identifying OpenInverter devices and other CANopen-compatible equipment.

scriptos.name: DAC Output
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description: Set a GPIO output to a specific voltage using digital-to-analog converter (DAC).

scriptos.name: Display Benchmark
scriptos.author: JetPax
scriptos.description:
Benchmarks display performance. Measures FPS for various 
                         operations: full screen fills, partial updates, rectangles,
                         text rendering, and SPI throughput.

scriptos.name: ES8311 Play Sound
scriptos.author: jetpax
scriptos.description:
Plays a test tone through the ES8311 mono audio codec.
                        Generates a sine wave at the specified frequency and plays it for the specified duration.
                        Requires ES8311 hardware connected via I2C (control) and I2S (audio data).

scriptos.name: GPIO Input
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description:
Simple reader of low/high voltage signals on a GPIO (pin) input.
                          You can enable an internal pull resistor or not.

scriptos.name: GPIO Output
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description: Set a GPIO (pin) output to ON or OFF.

scriptos.name: Board Hardware Test
scriptos.author: JetPax
scriptos.description: Tests only the hardware features defined in your board.json. Reads the manifest and validates each enabled capability - skips anything not configured.

scriptos.name: I2C Detect
scriptos.author: JetPax
scriptos.description: Scan the I2C bus and display detected devices in Linux i2cdetect format. Shows a grid of all addresses 0x00-0x77 with -- for no device and the address for detected devices.

scriptos.name: I2C Slaves Scan
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description:
Initializes an I2C bus on two GPIO and scans it to find all the addresses of I2C slaves.
                          You can choose the bus identifier, the SCL and SDA GPIO as well as the frequency in MHz.

scriptos.name: Input Demo
scriptos.author: jetpax
scriptos.description:
Interactive input demonstration for WebREPL.
                         This ScriptO demonstrates the input() function working correctly over WebREPL.
                         It shows various input scenarios including:
                         - Basic input with prompts
                         - Input in a loop
                         - Simple number guessing game

scriptos.name: KT403A MP3 Player
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description:
For MP3 modules based on KT403A chipset like DFPlayer, Grove-MP3 v2 and more.
You will be able to connect your board via an UART bus, play all the sound files in loop from the intended storage source (microSD, USB, flash memory), adjust the volume but also choose an audio EQ effect (normal, pop, rock, jazz, classic, bass). Info: KT403A supports MP3 & WAV audio formats on FAT16 or FAT32 files system, 32 GB max for microSD.

scriptos.name: LEDs - DotStar RGB Strip
scriptos.author:
JC`zic for the colors demo
Damien P. George, Ladyada, Scott Shawcroft and Matt Trentini for the DotStar lib
scriptos.description: Try your DotStar RGB LEDs via SPI bus, compatible with strips APA102, SK9822, and more. You can choose the number of LEDs as well as the bus connectivity settings and the lighting in full power or in fading rainbow. The embedded library can be found via the link below.

scriptos.name: LEDs - NeoPixel RGB(+W/Y) Strip (Interruptible)
scriptos.author: jetPax from code by JC`zic
scriptos.description: NeoPixel RGB LEDs demo, compatible with strips WS2812(B), SK6812, ADAxxxx, APA106, FLORA and more. You can choose rainbow fade animation or static white, as well as the number and type of LEDs, brightness, fade speed, RGB protocol and LED frequency. The NeoPixel library was coded by Damien P. George.

scriptos.name: Magnet Sensor
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description: Allows to test the hall sensor of the ESP32 chip with detection of the two magnetic poles after automatic calibration.

scriptos.name: Max Threads
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description: Returns the maximum number of possible threads to create with the configurable stack size.

scriptos.name: Memory Check
scriptos.author: jetpax
scriptos.description: WebREPL-safe memory test. Checks available RAM and tests it by allocating a specified size of memory.

scriptos.name: NTP Time Sync
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description:
This tool synchronizes the UTC date and time from an NTP server.
                          You can choose the NTP server host to connect to and configure
                          your timezone to display the correct local time.

scriptos.name: PWM & Lighting
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description: Uses a PWM on a GPIO and varies its duty cycle to make a led flash smoothly from 0 to 3.3V.

scriptos.name: PWM & Servo Motor
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description:
Uses a PWM on a GPIO and drives a servo motor by varying its duty cycle.
                          Several options are available to configure the servo motor, such as pulse frequency, pulse width and rotation time.

scriptos.name: SD Card Complete
scriptos.author: jetpax
scriptos.description: Complete SD card init, mount, and test

scriptos.name: SD Card Mount Test
scriptos.author: jetpax
scriptos.description: Mount SD card and test read/write

scriptos.name: SD Card Test
scriptos.author: jetpax
scriptos.description: Test SD card on Scripto P4+C6 - Diagnostics

scriptos.name: ST7789 Display Demo
scriptos.author: JetPax
scriptos.description:
Display demo for ST7789-based LCD screens. Shows colorful graphics, 
                         text, and animations. Reads pin configuration from board.json 
                         for maximum portability across different boards.

scriptos.name: Syslog Test
scriptos.author: jetpax
scriptos.description:
Test syslog functionality by sending messages at different severity levels.
                         
                         Configure your syslog server address and port, then send test messages.
                         Messages will be sent via UDP to the syslog server (RFC 3164 format).
                         
                         IMPORTANT: rsyslog must be configured to accept remote UDP messages:
                         1. Edit /etc/rsyslog.conf
                         2. Uncomment: module(load="imudp") and input(type="imudp" port="514")
                         3. Restart: sudo systemctl restart rsyslog
                         
                         If syslog is not configured, messages will be silently ignored (no-op).

scriptos.name: Script Object template
scriptos.author: jetpax
scriptos.description:
This template is a guide to developing Script Objects in MicroPython.                          You just need a "dict" in your code, with the 2 commented lines above and below.                          You can create user inputs of various types (str, int, float, bool, list, dict) which are retrieved at runtime via the "args" class.
                          Use a "list" type to propose a choice between all the GPIO pins of the ESP32.
                          Also, use the "dict" type to propose a multiple choice via the "items" sub-tree.

scriptos.name: Status LED Color Control
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description:
Control the status LED color with a visual color picker.
                         
                         This ScriptO provides:
                         • Color picker UI to select LED color
                         • Real-time RGB value display
                         • Direct control of status LED
                         • Preview of selected color

scriptos.name: Async Tasks Test
scriptos.author: ScriptO Studio
scriptos.description: Tests multiple concurrent async tasks using bg_tasks. Shows interleaved output from tasks A and B.

scriptos.name: Test - Handler Direct
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description: Test httpserver.on() directly to diagnose routing.

scriptos.name: Test - Logging
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description: Test WebREPL logging functionality. This script demonstrates how to set up a logger with WebREPL handler to send log messages to ScriptO Studio's log sidebar. The logger automatically clears existing handlers to prevent duplicate messages.

scriptos.name: Test - Manual File Handler
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description: Manually implement file serving with httpserver.on().

scriptos.name: Stop Button Test
scriptos.author: ScriptO Studio
scriptos.description: Simple infinite counter to test the Stop button. Counts up forever until stopped. Also demonstrates logging if enabled

scriptos.name: Test - VFS Diagnostics
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description: Diagnose VFS mount points and filesystem structure.

scriptos.name: Test - WebFiles Clean
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description: Clean test of webfiles with proper unregistration.

scriptos.name: Test - WebFiles Diagnostic
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description: Check if webfiles handler gets called at all.

scriptos.name: Test - WebFiles Gzip
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description:
Tests automatic gzip compression support in webfiles module.
                         Creates both regular and .gz versions of test files.
                         When client sends "Accept-Encoding: gzip", the .gz version is served automatically.
                         This tests the new direct GIL file serving with mp_vfs_stat() gzip resolution.

scriptos.name: Test - WebFiles Minimal
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description: Minimal test - create one file and serve it.

scriptos.name: Test - WebFiles Serving
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description:
Test script to verify webfiles.serve() works correctly.
                         
                         This ScriptO:
                         1. Creates /test_webfiles/ directory via Python VFS
                         2. Creates a simple test.html file via Python VFS
                         3. Finds correct ESP-IDF VFS mount point
                         4. Serves it via webfiles.serve() (READ-ONLY)
                         5. Opens it in Studio modal
                         
                         IMPORTANT: webfiles uses ESP-IDF VFS directly,
                         while Python uses MicroPython VFS. The actual
                         filesystem is usually mounted at /flash in ESP-IDF.
                         
                         webfiles should ONLY READ files, never write,
                         to avoid corrupting MicroPython VFS metadata.

scriptos.name: Test - WebFiles Simple
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description:
Super simple webfiles test - no modal, just browse manually.
                         
                         Creates /test_simple/hello.html and tries to serve it.
                         Prints URLs to test in your browser.

scriptos.name: WebFiles Speed Test
scriptos.author: ScriptOMatic
scriptos.description: Measure file serving performance with various file sizes

scriptos.name: UART Test
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description: Initializes UART on given GPIO, optionally sends a canned command and displays received data.

scriptos.name: UDS Client Demo
scriptos.author: JetPax
scriptos.description:
Demonstrates UDS (Unified Diagnostic Services) client for reading data from ECUs.
                         
                         Uses ISO 15765-2 (ISO-TP) for transport and ISO 14229 (UDS) for services.
                         Supports ReadDataByIdentifier (0x22), DiagnosticSessionControl (0x10),
                         TesterPresent (0x3E), and OBD2 modes for compatibility.
                         
                         Configure TX/RX CAN IDs for your ECU. Common configurations:
                         • Standard OBD2: TX=0x7DF (broadcast), RX=0x7E8
                         • Physical addressing: TX=0x7E0, RX=0x7E8
                         • OpenInverter: TX=0x7E0, RX=0x7E8

scriptos.name: UDS Server Demo
scriptos.author: JetPax
scriptos.description:
Demonstrates UDS (Unified Diagnostic Services) server to make your device diagnosable.
                         
                         Turns your ESP32/pyDirect device into a diagnosable ECU that responds to UDS requests.
                         Useful for:
                         • Custom ECU simulation
                         • BMS/EVSE diagnostics
                         • Development and testing
                         • Learning UDS protocol
                         
                         Supports DiagnosticSessionControl (0x10), TesterPresent (0x3E),
                         ReadDataByIdentifier (0x22), WriteDataByIdentifier (0x2E), 
                         SecurityAccess (0x27), and RoutineControl (0x31).

scriptos.name: UI Plugin - Hello World
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description:
Minimal demonstration of the ScriptO UI Plugin Architecture.
                         
                         This ScriptO:
                         • Registers an HTTP route that serves a self-contained HTML page
                         • Sends a command to Studio to open the UI in a modal
                         • The UI is served directly from your ESP32 device
                         
                         This proves the end-to-end plugin flow where ScriptOs can provide 
                         their own web-based user interfaces without requiring any code changes 
                         in ScriptO Studio.
                         
                         The UI appears in an iframe modal and communicates directly with the device.

scriptos.name: UI Plugin - LED Color Picker
scriptos.author: ScriptO Team
scriptos.description:
Interactive LED Color Picker with RGB Sliders
                         
                         This ScriptO provides a beautiful UI to control the status LED:
                         • Real-time RGB color sliders (0-255)
                         • Live color preview
                         • Displays current RGB values
                         • Set LED to selected color instantly
                         • Predefined color buttons for quick selection
                         
                         The UI is served directly from your ESP32 device and communicates
                         with the device to change the LED color in real-time.

scriptos.name: USB Modem Status
scriptos.author: ScriptO Studio
scriptos.description:
Check USB modem connection status, enumeration, and interface details.
                          Shows device information, interface classes, and tests AT command communication.
                          Useful for debugging USB modem connectivity issues.

scriptos.name: Wi-Fi Scan
scriptos.author: JC`zic
scriptos.description: Performs a detailed scan of the wireless access points.

scriptos.name: iperf3 Server
scriptos.author: Damien P. George / Mod by Antigravity
scriptos.description:
Run iperf3 network performance tests.
                          Supports Server and Client modes, TCP/UDP, and Reverse mode.

extensions.name: CCS
extensions.author: JetPax
extensions.description: CCS/NACS DC Fast Charging - EVSE emulator for contactor closure

extensions.author: JetPax
extensions.description: Dala The Great's Battery Emulator - CAN-to-RS485 bridge for battery management systems. Bridges EV battery packs to solar inverters.

extensions.name: DTC
extensions.author: JetPax
extensions.description: Diagnostic Trouble Codes - Read, display, and clear DTCs from vehicle ECUs via UDS/OBD2. Includes 12,000+ code descriptions.

extensions.name: GVRET
extensions.author: JetPax
extensions.description: High-performance GVRET implementation for MicroPython. Enables SavvyCAN connection over TCP/IP (mpDirect) for vehicle network analysis.
extensions.iconSvg: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-topology-bus" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/><path d="M14 10a2 2 0 1 0 -4 0a2 2 0 0 0 4 0z" /><path d="M6 10a2 2 0 1 0 -4 0a2 2 0 0 0 4 0z" /><path d="M22 10a2 2 0 1 0 -4 0a2 2 0 0 0 4 0z" /><path d="M2 16h20" /><path d="M4 12v4" /><path d="M12 12v4" /><path d="M20 12v4" /></svg>

extensions.name: OVMS
extensions.author: JetPax
extensions.description: Pushes vehicle metrics to an OVMS v2 server for remote monitoring.
extensions.iconSvg: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-car" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/><path d="M7 17m-2 0a2 2 0 1 0 4 0a2 2 0 1 0 -4 0" /><path d="M17 17m-2 0a2 2 0 1 0 4 0a2 2 0 1 0 -4 0" /><path d="M5 17h-2v-6l2 -5h9l4 5h1a2 2 0 0 1 2 2v4h-2m-4 0h-6m-6 -6h15m-6 0v-5" /></svg>

extensions.name: OpenInverter
extensions.author: JetPax
extensions.description: Complete OpenInverter suite. Configure parameters, map CAN messages, view spot values, and plot real-time signals from OpenInverter motor controllers.
